nodes.text: Trymant IV was a terrestrial planet in the Trymant system of the Outer Rim Territories. Once a lush arboreal world, its surface was covered with trees and bodies of water. The most densely populated planet in the system, its most densely populated region was Bralanak City. During the High Republic Era, it was threatened by an Emergence of the Great Hyperspace Disaster and simultaneously attacked by the Nihil pirates, prompting the Jedi Order and Galactic Republic to send assistance. However, the disaster caused Trymant IV to be shifted in its orbit around its two suns, resulting in ecological devastation as it was transformed into a desert.

Trymant IV was a terrestrial planet, located in the Trymant system of the Outer Rim Territories. Originally a lush arboreal world, its surface was covered in trees and bodies of water, including many rivers and lakes. However, the Emergences caused a disaster which destroyed Trymant IV's ecology, transforming it into a desolate red desert.
It was orbited by multiple moons, the closest of which was Praknat 3.

During the High Republic Era, Trymant IV was a densely populated planet, the most dense in its system. Its most dense population centre, Bralanak City, was inhabited by, among others, a commune of the Elders of the Path, a religious group which disdained use of the Force.

Around 232 BBY, the galaxy was rocked by the Great Hyperspace Disaster, an incident in which the freighter Legacy Run was destroyed in hyperspace. The subsequent Emergences of the starship's debris caused widespread disruptions to hyperspace travel, as it was difficult to predict where further debris would appear. The Nihil, an Outer Rim pirate group with unusual means of hyperspace travel, took advantage of the chaos. Eventually, Trymant IV was threatened by one Emergence, which was reported to the Galactic Republic by the crew of Republic Security Zone Monitoring Satellite 777B-Alpha, in orbit around the planet. The closest ship available to respond was the Star Hopper, a Padawan Academic Cruiser in service to the Jedi Order which was carrying a class of Padawans under the supervision of Jedi Grand Master Yoda and Jedi Master Torban Buck, and it immediately diverted to help.

Many of the pieces of debris threatened Bralanak City. Amid the chaos, Zeen Mrala and Krix Kamerat, two young acolytes of the Elders of the Path, attempted to make their way to the Elders' meeting house, where Kamerat was certain they would find assistance. At the same time, however, a Nihil Spider Cruiser arrived in the city and landed at the meeting house: Marchion Ro, the Eye of the Nihil, wanted the services of Elder Tromak, who knew secrets relating to an ancient relic which was sacred knowledge to the sect.

By the High Republic Era, Trymant IV was the most densely populated planet in its system. Its population was a diverse one, with members of many different species living there. A commune of the Elders of the Path, a religious sect which shunned the use of the Force, lived in Bralanak City at the time of the Trymant IV disaster.

The most densely populated area of Trymant IV before the disaster was Bralanak City, a city situated on an island in the middle of a larger body of water. Structures within the city included a meeting house used by the resident commune of the Elders of the Path.
